bibl.title: Memorandum from Mario G. Lebredo to Henry Rose Carter, April 18, 1921

div1.p: Lebredo informs Carter of his latest research and the International Sanitary Convention of the American Republics meetings.

div1.head: Memorandum from Mario G. Lebredo to Henry Rose Carter, April 18, 1921
div1.opener:
Answered April 28
Again May 24
SECCION DE INVESTIGACIONES, LABORATORIOS
Y ESTUDIOS
DE LAS ENFERMEGADES INFECCIOSAS
----
Lebredo
MEMORANDUM
----
Havana April 18 de 1921.
Dr. H. R. Carter.
Baltimore
Dear Dr. Carter.
div1.p:
I have the pleasure
to send to you a copy of a
paper I have just published
on experimental leptospirilosis
icteroides, in guinea pigs.
My next paper, I am wrighting,
is on experimental leptospi-
rilosis icteroides in adult
dogs, that have been of
very interesting results. As
soon as I print it, I shall
send you a copy.

Those experimental works
were done some months ago,
but I was obliged to delay
the publication, because
I went in last December
to Montevideo, to attend
C1

Sehizo ya un resumen
the VI International Sanitary
Convention of the American
Republics, that since the year
1911 had no meeting. The
convention was a little gene-
ral one, as it was done quite a
balance of the sanitary con
ditions of the Countries that
were represented.

The next meeting is going
to be held in Havana in
1923, I and I had the honor
to be elected the provisional
President. In the future
I shall have you instructed
of the organization and the
Program that we shall
prepare for to be discussed.

Will you be so kind as
to remember mi to your
daughter?

I was sorry in passing
by Callao I could not stop
for some days to see you.

Hoping you feell well and
happy, I remain yours
